headline: Apple Stock: Did President Trump Just Give Investors a Reason to Sell?
summary: President Trump wants iPhones assembled in the United States, which would be expensive for Apple.  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) has optimized its costs through a global manufacturing footprint.  This relationship -- specifically with China -- may be coming to an end if President Donald Trump gets his way.

headline: Will Tesla have to play catch up to Waymo's robotaxis?
summary: Tesla (TSLA) looks to move into its "golden age," according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, through the rollout of its robotaxi beta in Austin, Texas, on June 12. Waymo — whose parent company is tech giant Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) — remains Tesla's biggest robotaxi competitor with years of data to back it up. DVx Ventures CEO Jon McNeill explains what is still setting Waymo apart from Tesla. McNeill previously served as the president of Tesla (TSLA) between 2015 and 2018, the chief operating officer of Lyft (LYFT) from 2018 until the next year, and was a member of General Motors' (GM) board. Also catch Gerber Kawasaki Wealth & Investment Management CEO Ross Gerber — a long-time Tesla investor and Elon Musk critic — share his thoughts on Waymo's robotaxi model as compared to Tesla's plans with Yahoo Finance. McNeill also discusses expanding investments into the AI ecosystem, beyond just Nvidia (NVDA), through this ETF in this clip here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: 2 Nasdaq Stocks to Buy in June
summary: Investors could be significantly underestimating Google's artificial intelligence capabilities.  Amazon's cloud computing business continues to show monster growth potential.  The Nasdaq is full of tech-centric companies that are driving change and innovation in the economy, which is where you'll find stocks with monster growth potential.

headline: Will Apple Reclaim Its Title as the Largest Company in the World by Market Cap? The Answer May Surprise You.
summary: Apple was the largest company by market cap for more than a decade but recently was dethroned by Microsoft and Nvidia.  The company is growing sales much slower than Nvidia or Microsoft.  Apple's slow growth and risks to its earnings mean it will likely not regain its market cap leadership position.

headline: 5 Brilliant Stocks to Buy in June
summary: Nvidia and Taiwan Semiconductor are still benefiting from the AI race.  Alphabet and Adobe are beaten down due to fears of AI replacing them.  Amazon investors should be focused on cloud computing, not commerce.

headline: Prediction: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Could Be the Next Great Value Play
summary: This value opportunity is a member of the "Magnificent Seven."  Although its business model is uncertain, investors are likely underestimating the company's ability to redefine itself.  Perhaps one of the more surprising AI value plays is Google parent Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG).
